On december 3, 2012
Moderator

[ http://twinoid.com/en/article/3895/mana-war-the-second-coming ]

So, you've been training your dinoz all year in the IDT, honing their skills. You've taken them to exciting new lands in search of knowledge and experience. You've conversed with Gods and pushed your dinoz to levels you never thought possible... but is it enough?

The 2nd Great Mana War is starting in 4 days!

You can check out all the rules for this event in the DinoRPG Game Guide.

We have made some changes, following much discussion with the community:

  • Defender recovery has been slowed right down, so make sure you have plenty dinoz lined up!
  • Clans will now be able to see what time the tax collector will visit whether the castle is destroyed or not.
  • It is now possible to lauch a counter-attack against EVERYONE who attacks you!
  • The cost of rebuilding your castle will remain at 5000 gold coins. This cost will be reduced if your castle is partially rebuilt. A castle which is 40% rebuilt will only cost 60% of the total cost.
  • The honour bonus awarded after paying the taxman will stay at 10 points. There is no honour gain at midnight.
  • Clans will not be penalized if they don't declare war on any given day.

Have courage Dinoz Master! The pantheon of glory is opening its doors for you! If you have any questions, ask in the forums!


Prizes!

The King has revealed the prizes for the Great Mana War, which will begin in a matter of days. War will begin at 12h00 server time on Friday the 7th of December.

Winning clan: Winner's Epic Reward + 2 Napodinos + 200 Demon Tickets + 150 Treasury Notes
2nd + 3rd clan: Epic Reward + 2 Napodinos + 150 Demon Tickets + 100 Treasury Notes
4th - 6th clan: Epic Reward + 2 Napodinos + 100 Demon Tickets + 50 Treasury Notes
7th - 10th clan: Epic Reward + 1 Napodinos + 200 Demon Tickets + 100 Treasury Notes
11th - 15th clan: Epic Reward + 1 Napodinos + 100 Demon Tickets + 100 Treasury Notes
16th - 20th clan: Participation Reward + 1 Napodinos + 100 Demon Tickets + 25 Treasury Notes
21st - 25th clan: Participation Reward + 50 Demon Tickets
26th - 30th clan: Participation Reward + 25 Demon Tickets

Will you take home the bragging rights, the napoz and all the epic rewards? Time will tell, Dinoz Master. Time will tell...

The text in guide is not detailed enough.

Each clan begins with 100 honour points and can accumulate up to 200. Every day, the King sends a tax collector to your castle. If you pay the tax on time you gain honour points. A Clan cannot declare war against a clan which has more honour points than they do. If they wish to attack this clan, they must earn more honour points or be patient and wait a few days.

On january 4, 2013
Piemaster
druid2k

4) because of this system would prefer built up castles, the attacking the same clan penalty has to be increased: the -10 penalty is not enough, because of the +10 gain per day, a clan can attack the same clan every other day. so I would say -40 for the first 24hr, -30 for the second, -20 for the 3rd and -10 for the 4th day (and 0 penalty after 96 hrs). (actually this would protect a clan for 3 days only.. )

5) either increase the penalty for attacking lower ranked clan (like -1,-2,-3,-4, etc per positions to prevent big clans always hitting weaker clans), or decrease the reputation gain per day to 5.

You're right, the mana wars as they exist at the moment clearly aren't working. Any system that directly rewards attacking and/or defending, without providing a corresponding disincentive for the other side is clearly open to abuse. Therefore it makes sense to reward things that can only exist at a flat rate and isn't scalable, such as the amount of time your castle spends up.

However, this is something that would have to be balanced quite carefully. If you create a system where clans are rewarded for having their castle up (which is good I think) then you need to create an environment where the mid-level clans actually have the ability to keep their castle up for some length of time without getting repeatedly smashed down by the elite clans. If your clan is in 20th place then even if the top 10 clans can only attack you once every four days then that's still more than twice a day your castle gets taken down by a clan you can't hope to stop. And that doesn't even count the clans in position 11-19 who you might also have difficulty with.

On the other hand you don't want to create a situation where, like in the old vanilla clan wars, after the first couple of weeks you have beaten everyone once and there is nobody to attack so you are just sitting there clicking refresh the whole time waiting for an obscure clan to build their castle.

There are no easy solutions, but it seems the lessons of the previous mana war were not learned and some proper thinking needs to be done before the next one.

On january 10, 2013
Loxagon

The Suggestion of gaining no mana for hitting walls, but gaining it for having walls up is a really good one I think. If only the same mana is exchanged by winner and looser it's a distribution war, not a production war. The production of mana can be done by having walls up and by paying the taxman (maybe even when down). Its just a matter of weighting things out like how much is produced against possible losses by mana stolen from opponents by war.
Also I think we could get rid of honour. It's good for nothing. It does not protect small clans. Even now the clan on rank 1 can strike down to rank 47 and by paying the tax get back to 200 honour.
What does protect smaller clans at least from medium ones is mana gain/loss. For a medium clan it becomes unattractive to attack a small clan as soon as the possible gain is lower than the mana lost due to being taken down by a bigger clan. But this does not work for bigger clans as usually noone takes them down.

So my recommendation would be to get rid of honour and introduce a MANA penalty for attacking lower ranked clans. This way even top clans will find it unattractive to attack small clans because if the mana gap between them is to large they will lose more mana than they can win. The height of the penalty should in some way be figured by the difference in the mana pools of attacker and defender and not by ranking, as the ranking in some cases does not represent the real situation (by having big gaps or several clans close in mana).
No penalty for attacking clans with more mana, but no additional gain also (besides the 5% for a win).
If several clans attack the same clan, each of them needs to pay the penalty (if required), but the 5% don't go to last hit. Instead they are distributed by the percentage of castle damage done by each clan.
The question is if there should be an additional mana penalty for repeated attacks on the same clan in a given time frame and how high it should be.

I know it's a dangerous thing to introduce a way to take mana out of the system (declaring for more than you gain or declaring with penalty and not winning or getting your win reduced by other attackers), but the mana production should be in a size that the whole system could buffer these losses.

All this could lead to the following changes:

- there still may be friendly takedowns to deny others the mana of an ally, but at least no additional mana is produced by that. Instead the clan taken down produces no mana for being up.

- having limited wars per day, clans probably would rather grab the mana of opponents than the mana of allies

- smaller clans might actually be able to lead war against each other without too much interference from outside (fewer clans able to attack them). And you can always ask attackers to wait for you finishing your business (common practice nowadays, because it's usually a win/win situation)

- top clans may have a lack of targets in the lower ranks, but hopefully a better selection in the medium ranks as those are more likely to build for mana production.


Surely I have missed some things, and this system might be abused too in some ways. So far it's only an idea, seeing that honour really does not anything good for this war.

My mind is not set on the matter, but i sure feel like it favors a bit too much the water and air elements.

With timed combat, the idea was to strike fast and hard (and rocky and wanwan were popular).
Now, since battles are long, it favors: long term survivability, and slow attrition.
So:
: Mutation and Sumo
Defense: Bubble, dodge, bubble, vap form.
Attrition: Acid Blood, Accupuncture. Torch too, but torch hurts yourself a lot in a long battle, and it can be removed. Accu and Acid Blood have no drawback.
Getting numerical advantage: No Mercy, Black-Hole.


So, i just think are really favored here, since with the current rules, the point is not as much to kill as it is "surviving". And watching a lot of battle videos, it's obvious this war is good for Kabuki, Clouds, and specially Winks and Sirains with high Acid Blood.

I think that any regeneration in combat or reviving/healing after combat should cost ingredients from the treasury. There is no resource management or strategy with these new cheap wars that cost very little in gold and ingredients. The value of Collecting skills has been nerfed worse than Bubble.

However, I don't like the entirety of the Manawar rules. There needs to be fundamental changes to the system. That's why I suggested the contest so many pages before.
- Treasuries should be meaningful and important in Wars.
- Basic War rules should not be abuse-able with farming strategies.
- Basic War rules should make alliances a viable strategy vs higher ranked clans.
- Basic War rules should make the War increasingly harder as a clan's rank gets higher... harder to both increase your clan's rank and harder to defend your clan's rank.

One thing I would like to see would be something like: when a clan takes down a castle... the attacker has to occupy the ruins as long as possible with its own forces. Only dinoz that participated in the attack can defend the ruins and they don't auto-heal. Clans could get more points for both the duration of the occupation and the number of simultaneous occupations. The clan owning the castle needs to retake the ruins to rebuild, and needs their castle back up to gain points and wage war. Allied clans that are below the rank of the occupying clan can assist in retaking the ruins.

Instead of costing ingredients perhaps it should cost mana. This is a mana war but what good is the mana anyway?

I think a system set up where healing a dinoz cost 3 mana for an attacker 45-60 2 mana for an attacker 30-45 and 1 mana below level 30. Also incentatives should be given where if you attack with five it will cost 5 less mana, if you attack with 4 if will cost 3 less mana and if you attack with 3 it will cost 1 less mana.

If the attacking team is 5 level 55 dinoz then the mana cost would be 15-5=10.
If the attacking team is 4 level 55 dinoz then mana cost would be 12-3=9
If the attacking team is 3 level 55 dinoz then mana cost would be 9-1=8.
If the attacking team is 4 level 40 dinoz then the mana cost would be 8-3=5.
If the attacking team is 1 level 40 and 4 level 29 the mana cost would be 6-5=1.


If you attack with a single dinoz below level 30 it will cost 1 mana, 2 dinoz below 30 is two mana but also three dinoz below 30 would also cost 2 mana as well.

Using this system if lower ranked clans go to war it will cost far less mana then higher ranked clans, since the dinoz are ranked lower generally and since lower ranked clans already have more of a difficulty to produce mana this will help keep their mana cost down. This will also give slight incentative bonus to attacking with groups of 4 and groups of 5 and scouting with more then a single dinoz.

When a large clan decides to hound a smaller clan with their biggest dinoz it will now become quite costly if you do not plan and strategize.

On january 16, 2013
slyfox

lets ignore discussion in regards to farming and paying taxes with castle down....

All other aspects of the war, including old and new changes...that is what I would like to discuss....

Take for example why is it called a mana war? We produce all this mana paying taxman and yet we have nothing to use this mana for. Other wars the mana had uses like upgrades to castle, etc. Now we produce mana for no real apparent reason.

I would like more ideas tossed out there for the use of the actual mana itself.

I had an idea before about the use of the mana and I am going to throw it out there again.
I think a system set up where healing a dinoz cost 3 mana for an attacker 45-60 2 mana for an attacker 30-45 and 1 mana below level 30. Also incentatives should be given where if you attack with five it will cost 5 less mana, if you attack with 4 if will cost 3 less mana and if you attack with 3 it will cost 1 less mana.

If the attacking team is 5 level 55 dinoz then the mana cost would be 15-5=10.
If the attacking team is 4 level 55 dinoz then mana cost would be 12-3=9
If the attacking team is 3 level 55 dinoz then mana cost would be 9-1=8.
If the attacking team is 4 level 40 dinoz then the mana cost would be 8-3=5.
If the attacking team is 1 level 40 and 4 level 29 the mana cost would be 6-5=1.

If you attack with a single dinoz below level 30 it will cost 1 mana, 2 dinoz below 30 is two mana but also three dinoz below 30 would also cost 2 mana as well.

Using this system if lower ranked clans go to war it will cost far less mana then higher ranked clans, since the dinoz are ranked lower generally and since lower ranked clans already have more of a difficulty to produce mana this will help keep their mana cost down. This will also give slight incentative bonus to attacking with groups of 4 and groups of 5 and scouting with more then a single dinoz.

When a large clan decides to hound a smaller clan with their biggest dinoz it will now become quite costly if you do not plan and strategize.

On january 18, 2013
Husaurus

I think the current prize structure does not promote the participation we would all like to see. I think the participation awards should not be rank based, and be more like the Monster Hunt awards for levels of accomplishment, like a set amount of mana collected, or number of wars won vs other active clans, etc. I think there should also be accumulated awards for battles won and hard fought losses... these awards could be direct, like the participation awards, or incorporated into a new ranking system. I think there should be a new ranking system, which has slightly higher prizes for each and every ranking, to keep clans involved and fighting.

I think Mana and Honor should be dumped, and replaced with a Banner system, and the value of each clan's Banner collected changes as the clans rise and fall in the rankings. The goal would be to Collect as many War Banners as possible, from other clans by winning wars... and in the event of losing a War, collect as as many of the winning clan's Honor Badges as possible by repelling a wave of attackers. Banners and Badges would be used to calculate Rank and Participation.

I think Castles should auto-rebuild on a random countdown visible only to that Clan. A Clan can rebuild early but cannot stay down strategically.

Alliances would yield "Allied Banners", and are only counted if the losing clan is higher ranked than all the winning allied clans. The Alliance system would be the only way for multiple attackers to be declared at the same time. When two clans are at war, then other clans would have their declare option changed to a request to be an ally option (If they are not already approved as an Ally)... this would work either for the allying with the attacker or with the defender for the counter. If both side of a war decline allies, then a third option would appear which would be a spoiler option, to keep clans from hiding behind wars with friends... specifics to be worked out later.

Preapproved Allies would allow smaller clans to leave the door open for their friend-clans to counter in off hours while they can't be online. Another option could be for a clan to select to allow any clans below the rank of the attacker to be approved as an ally. This could make things more interesting for the Big Clans... an easy target could turn into an almost server wide counter attack.

Finally, I think the Clan's treasury should be used for re-equipping defending dinoz. Dinoz would have to be equipped when set to defend, but after each attack, the Clan's Treasury would be used (with some settings and options by the clan leader) to buy duplicate items. Any replacement items should probably vanish when that dinoz is removed from defense.

I think something along these lines, even if it is not exactly this scheme, would make the next War a much better experience.

bace135

I have held my tongue for the entire war, so I apologize in advance if this post becomes lengthy. The points I would like to make are as follows:

1. Congratulations Rakshasa for your win. You certainly have a formidable lineup.

2. Farming didn't ruin the mana wars, oversights by MT and the event design ruined mana wars. The taxman bug certainly contributed but everyone understands that by now. On top of that, having the taxman come only during a set 6 hours also contributed since all the "real" action occurred only for a couple hours. And guess what, if you aren't in Europe, you most likely can't make it for those hours. Also, repeatedly beating up on clans with lower level dinoz than yours is not fun. Repeatedly being beat up by clans with higher level dinoz than yours is also not fun. So remove the farming and tell me if you would still be having fun? How many clans repeatedly attacked clans that were as strong or stronger than themselves (while not farming)? I can think of a couple, but it certainly wasn't more than 3. So please don't tell me farming ruined the mana wars. As an active farmer, I will say I actually had more fun farming because I got to talk with people from other clans and actually got to do something. Most of the times when I'm able to come online, all the castles are down except the few top clans that my clan can't really attack (except in special circumstances). Additionally, for the people complaining about farming, the only reason there were ANY clans with castles up for you to attack was because of farming. You would have been even MORE bored if there was no farming.

Also, I find it funny that some of the biggest clans act like they are special for not farming. C'mon, you have boatloads of level 57+ dinoz and tons of napos for putting that black hole item on dinoz, etc. And you want me to think you are special for not farming? You crack me up. And the people who make me laugh the most are those that barely did anything in those clans during the manawars and then get on the forums talking about they are proud to be in a clan that doesn't farm. I invite you all to join a clan that can't just bumrush anybody they want when they want and see if you still feel the same way.

3. I want to thank all the people who contributed whining, vulgarity, crying and self righteousness to the forums during the war. They certainly made it more entertaining to read than the normal boring discussions.

4. And lastly, I will leave you with quotes from Mana War 1. It made sense to me then, and it makes sense to me now...

Please accept that this war is not about who beat "Rakshasa/LOoT/Void Allieance/BBC/etc, and how many times. It is about collecting mana - as the rules says."

"we have the brain to put 3-4 things together and the outcome will be better than if we would play 'push the button to destroy the weaker clans'. this is called strategy. using timing, organizing things, working with allies, etc."

"war is about alliances, cooperation, diplomacy and strategy."

-All quotes from DRUID2K

On january 18, 2013
[939316]
PiemasterUm... no it doesn't

Again interested to see the argument.

My side: there are too many variables to say that just because there is a lot of participation on one server means that there should be the same participation on another server. The logic is flawed.

Different masters, time zones (clock resets around 6-8pm in NA and midnight in France), different cultures, game originated in French (assumption by me), more devs on FR, more active mods/feedback, greater number makes for different strategies, less buggy code, more/different levels of dinos, etc. All these add up and the end result is that NOBODY can say with any certainty WHAT the issue is without testing by changing one variable here at a time. One thing is certain: to make a conclusion as above is post hoc. I could say it is because of the phases of the moon, but that too would be a post hoc argument.

The conclusion may be right -- but I don't think it is. Why not give better rewards and see?
On january 18, 2013
Piemaster

I was merely arguing with your use of the phrase Post hoc ergo propter hoc. This is a description of a very specific logical fallacy meaning literally "after this, therefore because of this" or, less abstractly, "correlation implies causation".

There was nothing in Kayin's post that implied any kind of correlation whatsoever with anything. He was merely saying that relative to our population we have much better prizes than the French server. Nearly half of the participating clans got napos.

Husaurus
VenarMust be careful here: this is exactly why battle give mana: to push players to fight. But it lead to farming.

I can't tell if you are cautioning me specifically, or if you are making a general statement about failed attempts in the past.

Anyway, Mana was introduced in Wars to be used for spells and stuff. Manawars came later because, presumably, useful Mana further imbalanced the War system.

In Manawars, Mana is only gained on a win, so there is no point to a clan fighting a battle that it will probably lose. So it isn't really "exactly why a battle gives mana" except as a failed attempt to do that. A balanced War system that both encourages Clans to be scrappy [meaning "full of fighting spirit"] even when they are the wild underdog... and also can't be abused... shouldn't be that hard to set up. However, tweaking the current Manawar system to make it work is more analogous to tweaking the US tax code to make it work fairly without loopholes.

I guess my only point is that I don't understand the intent of the comment.

On january 20, 2013
andros

To get a nice war system we need to ensure some key things:

1. There needs to be an intension to build up the castle. Otherwise there are no targets and thus no war.
- e.g. Jeno's suggestion of giving mana per hour while up.
- not being able to see when the taxman arrives while down (this special rule for our server was bad in hindsight).

2. No trading: winning and losing to the same clan shouldnt give any profit (chains as well)
- Jeno's suggestion to just give the 5% mana per war works again
- a capture the flag/banner system suggested by someone.

3. I think alliances should be useful (without trading)

4. Other resources besides the strength of dinoz should have an impact. So the ranking is not predetermined. Resources like aktivity, planing, etc.

5. Ensure participation by having a nice ratio between prices and costs.
- e.g. Venar's suggestion to add new useful items two prices
- you could give prices besides the ranking: getting angel
potions and bread for a won battle (if no autoheal), or prices for
winning 10, 20, 30 battles



Points one and two give the structure of the war and points three and four are given by the battle system.

Removing autoheal could really do it for points 3 and 4. It sounds more costly at first but i think it just spreads the costs to all active members.
Going back to a fixed number of defenders or reducing autoheal could be good as well.
I think balancing between the attacking and defending side is really hard. Right now the defenders have an advantage but i doubt we could find a balance just by theory crafting.
Since we cannot test our suggestions i think its best to change as little as possible. this way we have some benchmarks.

On january 21, 2013
Stinkymeat

One way that could possibly increase activity and incentive is rooted in the theory of economic policy and taxation: if you want to increase certain behavior, it is easiest to give economic incentive to do it.

We have pretty decent and generous prize structures, and defenders/attackers get healed at the end of wars. But the cost of irmas to move to war and items used are very expensive and limit desire.

What about giving all attacks with teams of 3 500 per dinoz that attacks without it being dependent upon the success of the attack? This would give some money for travel and items and give added incentive to do more.

Incentives are good at changing behavior and giving money regardless of success could incentivize more people to go for the walls and attack in swarms.

On january 21, 2013
Husaurus
druid2kI'm asking the mid level clans (ranked 6-20): what do you think, recovery system is good for you/your clan or not?

It make some clans essentially unbeatable. You build up your clan, and a couple powerful masters can join any otherwise tiny clan and put up a devastating defense.
It also means that few masters in a clan can properly wage a war, since the clan's best dinoz are needed to be online to have a reasonable chance to get through that initial defense... so it excludes a lot of players from full participation, and doesn't reduce the time demands on weaker clans.

Overall, the recovery system favors stronger clans, who don't need the favor. The top clans can break your defense regardless of recovery, while it protects the top clans while they are offline. Mid-Clans are not helped by recovery unless the attacking clan is significantly weaker or the Mid-Clan happens to have the right members online to maintain their dinoz.

Something needs to be changed about recovery, maybe [ here is yet another idea from crazy old Hu ] health recovery should have a threshold, like it doesn't kick in unless a dinoz has lost 25%+ health... THEN that dinoz heals *and* gets sent to the bottom of the defense list.

VenarJust remove mana, it's a silly concept.

I agree. Honor is also a bit silly, imo.

On january 22, 2013
slyfox

I have a suggestion....

Keep the healing structure the same except for one thing. If a player wishes to use an attacking dinoz again or a defending dinoz again, it must wait 5 minutes for attacking dinoz and 10 minutes for defending dinoz then they can manually heal the dinoz with angel potions and warm breads. This way a player can use their attacking team twice in the time it takes a defender to heal their dinoz once.

The problem is it could nearly make a defense unlimited. So rules will need that a player can only bring a dinoz back to life 5 times during a battle, where as a defending dinoz can only be removed from defense twice. Also once a dinoz was removed from defense twice it cannot be placed back into defense for the rest of the duration of that battle.

Lets say Clan A had attacked Clan B. One of the members had a dinoz that died 3 times and the war was a stalemate. Clan C declares on clan A and begins attacking clan A. That same member now could either heal the same dinoz for 4th time for attacking, or be placed in the clan walls for defense. That member places dinoz in defense. It dies once member heals it puts it back in defense. Now clan C cannot get through the defense. member then removes dinoz from defense and begins counter attacking clan C. Clan B decides it is time to begin counter attacking clan A. Member wants to put dinoz back in defense but cannot. Member now either continues attacking clan C or goes back to attacking clan B. Dinoz dies 5th time while attacking. That dinoz can no longer be used for attacking or defending.

Wars end. All dinoz are healed.

This way a scout can be used 5 times with just a single hp of mana. however there will be a five minute interval between healing a scout.

Smaller clans can continue to fight the battles the same way they were previously if they so choose. I feel this may give lower tiered clans more of a fighting chance against the larger clans.

The issue of fair play often comes up in sports.

For example, fouls are well within the rules in most sports, teams just get a small penalty for them generally.
